member.name: P:Grasshopper.My.Resources.Res_TextData.Pangrams
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The wizard quickly jinxed the gnomes before they vaporized. The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog. Pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs. My faxed joke won a pager in the cable TV quiz show. Amazingly few discotheques provide jukeboxes. By Jove, my quick study of lexicography won a prize. Sixty zippers were quickly picked from the woven jute bag. Just keep examining every low bid quoted for zinc etchings. Nechť již hříšné saxofony ďáblů rozzvučí síň úděsnými tóny waltzu, tanga a quickstepu. [rest of string was truncated]";.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Special.GH_Cluster.CreateFromDocument(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document)
member.summary: Recreate this cluster based on the provided document. The document will not be copied so it should be a unique instance reference. The document should have input and output hooks otherwise the cluster will have no input or output parameters.
member.param: Document to wrap. The document will not be copied, so be sure you supply a fresh one.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Special.GH_Cluster.CreateFromDocument(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Recreate this cluster based on the provided document. The document will not be copied so it should be a unique instance reference. The document should have input and output hooks otherwise the cluster will have no input or output parameters.
member.param: Document to wrap. The document will not be copied, so be sure you supply a fresh one.
Location for cluster object. This is typically the center of the boundingbox of the document.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Special.GH_Cluster.CreateFromSelection(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Recreate this cluster based on the selected objects in the provided document. The selection in the document will be copied so you do not have to supply a unique doc. The luster will be inserted into the provided document.
member.param: If true, the original objects will be deleted from the document.
If true, cluster inputs will be reconnected to the same sources as the original objects.
If true, cluster outputs will be reconnected to the same recipients as the original objects.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Special.GH_NumberSlider.HarvestDecimalPlaces(System.String)
member.summary: Try and harvest the number of decimal places implied by a piece of text. Text must represent a regular number.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Special.GH_NumberSlider.HarvestRange(System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Parse an init code for validity. Valid init codes are A<B, A<B<C, A..B, A..B..C Where A, B and C can all be evaluated to doubles or integers. This method does not validate whether the actual values of A, B and C are non-decremental. Note that sliders can also be initiated using init codes that evaluate to single numbers. This method does not take those into account. This is purely for validating range inits.
member.param: If text is a valid init code, the minimum descriptor will be returned here.
If text is a valid init code, the maximum descriptor will be returned here.
If text is a valid init code with a value portion, the value descriptor will be returned here.
member.returns: True if the text is a valid init code.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentServer.ExternalFiles(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Get lists of all the external files (GHA, GHUSER and GHCLUSTER) that will be loaded by Grasshopper. Note: this does not equal the files that may already have been loaded, just the files that we'll attempt to load if we were asked to load all plugins now. The list contains no duplicate file paths, but it may contain identical files which won't be filtered until actual loading.
member.param: If true, invalid duplicates of Grasshopper.dll will be tested for and warned about.
If true, duplicates of GHA, GHUSER and GHCLUSTER files will be tested for and warned about.

member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.IsEscapeKeyDown
member.summary: Gets whether the escape key was pressed since the last time this function was called. Though in reality the actual escape state is checked no more than once every 50 milliseconds or so, which should be sufficient for a smooth user experience.
member.remarks: If GetAsyncKeyState is called by some other application, it will mess with the value returned here, as GetAsyncKeyState is a system wide static method.
member.returns: True if escape was/is pressed, false if otherwise.

member.summary: Defines the delay used to indicate the schedule should be immedate and recursive.

member.summary: Callback signature for Scheduled Solutions.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleCallDelegates
member.summary: Trigger all callbacks. The callback list will be wiped once the callbacks are complete.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleDelay
member.summary: Gets the delay for the next scheduled solution. If there is no solution scheduled the delay will be negative.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleSolution(System.Int32)
member.summary: Schedule a new solution after a specified time interval. The schedule is erased if another solution is triggered before the schedule is executed. Tight schedules override loose schedules. If this method is called during a solution, the schedule will be started after the current solution completes.
member.param: The delay (in milliseconds) between the completion of this solution and the start of the scheduled solution. If the delay is 1ms or more, a timer will be used to trigger a new solution sometime in the future. If a delay of 0ms is used, then the next solution will run recursively within the current solution. You should not use a delay of zero milliseconds too often as it will cause the Rhino process to run out of stack-space. The SolutionDepth property can be used to see how deeply recursive the solution currently is.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.ScheduleSolution(System.Int32,Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.GH_ScheduleDelegate)
member.summary: Schedule a new solution after a specified time interval. The schedule is erased if another solution is triggered before the schedule is executed. Tight schedules override loose schedules. If this method is called during a solution, the schedule will be started after the current solution completes.
member.param: The delay (in milliseconds) between the completion of this solution and the start of the scheduled solution. If the delay is 1ms or more, a timer will be used to trigger a new solution sometime in the future. If a delay of 0ms is used, then the next solution will run recursively within the current solution. You should not use a delay of zero milliseconds too often as it will cause the Rhino process to run out of stack-space. The SolutionDepth property can be used to see how deeply recursive the solution currently is.
If not null, the callback will be called before the scheduled solution is triggered.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Profiler
member.summary: Gets or sets the profiler mode used in this document.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Owner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner of this document. A document is typically owned when it is subsidiary to some object, such as a cluster.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Nested
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this document is nested. A nested document is always part of some other document and is therefore unknown to the DocumentServer and the Canvas.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the enabled state for this document. Enabled documents respond to events and display their previews in the Rhino viewport.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.Context
member.summary: Gets or sets the context for this document. Note that the context is not a state so much as an action. Therefore it is not particularly useful to read the context after the fact, rather, context is mostly intended to be a setter, not a getter. When you set the context, all top-level document objects will be informed and the ContextChanged event will be raised.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.RuntimeID
member.summary: Gets the runtime ID of this document. RuntimeID is assigned once and never changed. It is also not deserialized so every document will always have a unique ID when loaded.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.DocumentID

member.summary: Remove the object from the document. This removal is the precursor to object deletion. Do not call this function if you intend to transfer the object to another GH_Document. This method does not add an Undo event, that is the responsibility of the caller.

If True, the solution will be recomputed.
member.returns: The number of objects actually deleted.

member.summary: Hoist all objects from another document into this one.
member.param: The other document. Cannot be Null or
member.remarks: The objects will be moved, not copied. The other document ends up being empty since objects can only belong to one document at a time.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.MergeDocument(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document,System.Boolean)

member.remarks: The objects will be moved, not copied. The other document ends up being empty since objects can only belong to one document at a time.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document.MergeDocument(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Hoist all objects from another document into this one.
member.param: The other document. Cannot be null.
If True, an attempt is made to repair proxy sources after insertion.

member.remarks: The objects will be moved, not copied. The other document ends up being empty since objects can only belong to one document at a time.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Exposure.obscure
member.summary: Mark the object as obscure. Use this option for components which are unlikely to be used often. You must combine obscure with one of the other flags (except hidden). Objects which are marked as Obscure will be the first to disappear when a ribbon resizes and they will always appear at the end of a panel.

member.summary: Returns the average coordinate of all items in this node. If this node does not contain any items, Point3d.Unset is returned.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.Limit
member.summary: Gets the subdivision limit for this tree. This limit can only be set once when you create a new tree. It is fixed forever after.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.NodeDepth
member.summary: Gets the recursive depth of this node. The tree root is at depth zero. The first subdivision is at depth one, and so on and so forth.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.WeightedSubdivision
member.summary: Gets or sets whether subdivision is weighted based on content averages. Setting this value will only affect future subdivisions, not existing ones.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IsMutable
member.summary: Gets whether this tree is mutable. You can only add items to mutable trees. We don't recommend removing items from unmutable trees, though that shouldn't necessarily lead to problems. Trees become unmutable after a call to ShrinkRegions(), CollapseNodes() or OptimizeTree().

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IsLeaf
member.summary: Gets whether this node is a leaf node. Leaf nodes have no child nodes.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IsTwig
member.summary: Gets whether this node is a twig node. Twig nodes have both parents and at least one child.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IsRoot
member.summary: Gets whether this node is a root node. Root nodes have no parent node and depth zero.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.RootNode
member.summary: Gets the ultimate root node for this tree.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ParentNode
member.summary: Gets the immediate parent of this node. Root nodes have no parent.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.NodeIndex
member.summary: Gets the index sequence from the root of the tree to this node.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.NextNode
member.summary: Gets the logical neighbour to the right of this node. There is no spatial relationships between logical neighbours, this is purely an iteration aid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.GetFirstChild
member.summary: Gets the first non-null child of this node.
member.returns: The first non-null child node or nothing if no such node can be found.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.GetFirstLeaf
member.summary: Gets the ultimate node starting from this node. The ultimate node is the first non-null node that no longer has any children.
member.returns: The first non-null leaf node in the subtree or this node.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ChildCount
member.summary: Gets the number of defined child nodes. Leaf nodes have no children. Root and twig nodes can have anywhere between 1 and 8 children.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ChildNode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the child node at the given index.
member.param: Index of child node to retrieve. Valid indices are from 0 to 7 inclusive.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ItemsGlobal
member.summary: Gets the list of all items stored inside this entire tree. Do not modify this collection unless you know what you are doing.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ItemsLocal
member.summary: Gets a list of all the items stored directly in this node. This list is constructed every time you access this property, so keep it down to a minimum.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ItemCount
member.summary: Gets the total number of items stored directly in this node.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IndicesLocal
member.summary: Gets the list of item indices that are contained within this node.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.IndicesRecursive
member.summary: Gets the list of item indices that are contained within this node and any child nodes.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.SubTree(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets an iterator for all nodes in this (sub)tree.
member.param: If true, nodes that contain other nodes will be skipped. Only nodes containing items will be included.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.ShrinkRegions
member.summary: Shrink the region for this node and all child nodes. Do not use this method if you intend to add more items later as it creates spatial gaps in the tree structure. You can shrink nodes if you're done adding items and want to start searching the tree.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.CollapseNodes
member.summary: Collapse the (sub)tree rooted at this node. Collapsing happens when a node only has a single child, in which case the child usurps the position previously held by the parent. Do not collapse a (sub)tree if you still plan to add items later.
member.returns: The new root for this (sub)tree. May well be an instance of this node if it cannot be collapsed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.TrimExcess
member.summary: Trim the excess space on all index lists. You can call this method to reduce memory usage. It will not modify the tree in any functional way.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.OptimizeTree
member.summary: Optimize this tree for fast searches. Do not call this method if you still plan to add items in the future. You can no longer modify this tree once it has been optimized.
member.returns: The new root of the optimized tree. If the root could not be optimized an instance of this node will be returned.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.SubDivide
member.summary: Create new child nodes and move all items in this node to those children. This method destroys the local point list and any pre-existing children.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Geometry.SpatialTrees.Node3d`1.Rebuild
member.summary: Aggregate all points in this node and re-build it.

member.summary: Builds a subtree from a Node list.
member.param: All the nodes that are supposed to be included in this tree.

A subset of nodes on which to perform the subdivision. Pass a null-pointer to use ALL nodes. If the list is not null, used indices will be extracted from the list, in order to reduce the number of pointless inclusion tests.
The number of allowed Nodes per Leaf. If a Leaf contains more than N nodes, it will subdivide.

member.summary: Removes empty leaves, empty nodelists and nodelist capacity overflow from this leaf and all subleaves.

member.summary: Base interface for all Data inside Grasshoper that could pass for Geometry

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.DuplicateGeometry
member.summary: Make a complete duplicate of this geometry. No shallow copies.
member.remarks: Each class that implements this interface should also provide a type specific duplication method

member.summary: Gets the (cached) boundingbox for this geometry. Not all geometry types cache boundingbox results.
member.returns: The boundingbox for this piece of geometry or Boundingbox.Empty if the geometry is null or invalid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.GetBoundingBox(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Compute an aligned boundingbox.
member.param: Transformation to apply to geometry for BoundingBox computation.
member.returns: The world aligned boundingbox of the transformed geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.Transform(Rhino.Geometry.Transform)
member.summary: Transforms the object or a deformable representation of the object.
member.returns: Transformed geometry. If the local geometry can be transformed accurately, then the returned instance equals this instance. Not all geometry types can be accurately transformed under all circumstances though, if this is the case, this function will return an instance of another IGH_GeometricGoo derived type which can be transformed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.Morph(Rhino.Geometry.SpaceMorph)
member.summary: Morph the object or a deformable representation of the object.
member.returns: Deformed geometry. If the local geometry can be deformed accurately, then the returned instance equals this instance. Not all geometry types can be accurately deformed though, if this is the case, this function will return an instance of another IGH_GeometricGoo derived type which can be deformed.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.ReferenceID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Guid of the object that is referenced. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.IsReferencedGeometry
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this geometry is referenced. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.IsGeometryLoaded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this geometry is currently loaded (assuming it is referenced). Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.LoadGeometry
member.summary: If the geometry is referenced and currently unloaded, forces loading of the geometry. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.LoadGeometry(Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: If the geometry is referenced and currently unloaded, forces loading of the geometry. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.IGH_GeometricGoo.ClearCaches
member.summary: Clears all caches. Typically if the geometry is referenced, this will erase the local copy.

member.returns: Transformed geometry. If the local geometry can be transformed accurately, then the returned instance equals this instance. member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of this type. Note that if the type has a ReferenceID this value might get destroyed in the future.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.ReferenceID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Guid of the object that is referenced. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry. The default implementation is to always return Guid.Empty.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.IsReferencedGeometry
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this geometry is referenced. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.IsGeometryLoaded
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this geometry is currently loaded (assuming it is referenced). Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry. The default is to always return True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.LoadGeometry
member.summary: If the geometry is referenced and currently unloaded, forces loading of the geometry. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.LoadGeometry(Rhino.RhinoDoc)
member.summary: If the geometry is referenced and currently unloaded, forces loading of the geometry. Not all IGH_GeometricGoo implementations support referenced geometry. The default is to always return True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.ClearCaches
member.summary: Clears all caches. Typically if the geometry is referenced, this will erase the local copy. If your T is a value-type, you must override this function and specifically unset the local value.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.CastFrom(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempt a cast from generic object.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: If False, the contents of this instance are not to be trusted.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Types.GH_GeometricGoo`1.CastTo``1(``0@)
member.summary: Attempt a cast to type T.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: If false, the target instance contents are not guaranteed to be valid.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_TaskCapableComponent
member.summary: GH_Component that can choose to support the use of Tasks to compute solutions When UseTasks returns true, the component has it's SolveInstance enumeration called twice. The first pass (InPreSolve=True) is intended solely for collecting data and starting calculation tasks. The second pass (InPreSolve=False) takes results or the tasks and sets the output.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_TaskCapableComponent.UseTasks
member.summary: Returns True if the component is set to support tasks. Components can have this feature turned on/off. Note that even if UseTasks returns True, there is a chance that a multipass task based solution may not be invoked depending on if multiple calls need to be made during enumeration. You must pay attention to the value of InPreSolve during SolveInstance. The set version of this property can be called by the framework if we want to provide a technique to globally turn on/off task support for all components in a definition.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_TaskCapableComponent.InPreSolve
member.summary: Is set to True by the framework right before a "use tasks" pass is made on SolveIntance calls. When True, SolveInstance should be using Tasks to start calculations on input data. When False, SolveInstance should be setting the output data by either using the result of a task or directly computing the results.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_TaskCapableComponent.RequestTaskCancellation
member.summary: Called by the framework when solving has been interrupted and tasks do not need to complete.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1
member.summary: Abstract implementation of IGH_TaskCapableComponent. Inherit from this class instead of implementing IGH_TaskCapableComponent directly.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.#ctor
member.summary: Custom blank constructor for naughty components.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor for this component. This function will call the PostConstructor which will initialize the parameters
member.param: The name of this component. Keep it short, single words are best.
The abbreviation of this component. Keep it short, 1~5 character words are best.
The description of this component. Be succinct but clear. You can supply whole sentences.
The category of this component. The category controls in which tab the component will end up.
the SubCategory for this component. The SubCategory controls in which panel the component will end up.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.GetSolveResults(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DataAccess,`0@)
member.summary: Call this method to await the associated task and retrieve its data.
member.param: Data (if any) will be returned here.
member.returns: If true, the data was successfully retrieved and can be assigned to outputs immediately. If false, the data was not found and needs to be calculated by the caller.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.UseTasks
member.summary: Returns True if the component is set to support tasks. Components can have this feature turned on/off. Note that even if UseTasks returns True, there is a chance that a multipass task based solution may not be invoked depending on if multiple calls need to be made during enumeration. You must pay attention to the value of InPreSolve during SolveInstance. The set version of this property can be called by the framework if we want to provide a technique to globally turn on/off task support for all components in a definition.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.SerializeUseTasks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the UseTasks value ought to be serialized.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TaskCapableComponent`1.InPreSolve
member.summary: Is set to True by the framework right before a "use tasks" pass is made on SolveIntance calls. When True, SolveInstance should be using Tasks to start calculations on input data. When False, SolveInstance should be setting the output data by either using the result of a task or directly computing the results.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject
member.summary: Base interface for objects that want to play on the Canvas. Do not implement this interface from scratch. Either inherit from GH_DocumentObject or one of the other partially finished types such as GH_ActiveObject, GH_Param(Of T) or GH_Component.

member.summary: Raises the SolutionExpired event on the toplevel object.
member.param: If True, the solution will be immediately recalculated.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject.ExpireSolution(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this function whenever you do something which expires the current solution. This will make sure all caches are erased, all downstream objects are expired and that the event is raised. The default implementation merely places a call to OnSolutionExpired(), override this function in derived classes to make sure you clear local data caches and expire downstream objects.
member.param: If True, the solution will be recomputed straight away.

member.summary: Raises the DisplayExpired event on the toplevel object.
member.param: If True, the canvas will be immediately redrawn.

member.param: The object that raised the event.

member.summary: Raises the PreviewExpired event on the toplevel object.
member.param: If True, the viewports will be immediately redrawn.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_DocumentObject.ExpirePreview(System.Boolean)

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.ClearUndoStack
member.summary: The stack with all undo records has been cleared.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.ClearRedoStack
member.summary: The stack with all redo records has been cleared. This always happens when a new undo record is added.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.RecordAdded
member.summary: A new undo record is added to the list. There will be a ClearRedoStack event after this one.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.RecordRemoved
member.summary: A specific record has been deleted. This is not a typical operation and is usually due to user intervention. Removal can occur from both the undo and the redo stack.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.Undo
member.summary: An undo operation was successfully completed. This means a record has been moved from the undo stack to the redo stack.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_UndoOperation.Redo
member.summary: A redo operation was successfully completed. This means a record has been moved from the redo stack back onto the undo stack. This does not count as a RecordAdded operation.

member.summary: Synch object for tracking long term changes to the parameter server.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.EmitSyncObject
member.summary: Create a synch object that stores a shallow representation of this server. Cache this object if you're planning to make sweeping changes to this param-server. Then, once you are finished call the Sync() function to perform cleanup of removed parameters. This is a utility function and you can choose to perform cleanup yourself.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.Sync(System.Object)
member.summary: Sync changes from a prerecorded state. All param references in the sync object which are no longer present in the current server will be properly deleted. The sync object will be reset in the process, so you can only call this function with a specific Sync object once.
member.param: Sync object. Should be obtained by calling EmitSyncObject()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.Sync(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ComponentParamServer.IGH_SyncObject)

member.param: Sync object. Should be obtained by calling EmitSyncObject()

member.summary: Add a single item to the persistent data. This method will record an undo event, raise the OnObjectChanged event for PersistentData flags and place a call to ExpireSolution(False). member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_PersistentParam`1.SetPersistentData(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Assign a list of items to the persistent data. If you want to add a tree of data, you should use the appropriate overload for this method.

member.summary: Convert the image to a greyscale shadow of its former self.

member.summary: Convert the image to a greyscale shadow of its former self.
member.param: Greyscale factor. 1.0 equals complete greyscale, 0.0 equals no greyscale, -1.0 equals inverse greyscale

member.summary: Invert all values in a specific channel.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_MemoryBitmap.Filter_Dullify

Amount of blurring for the shadow.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex
member.summary: Maintains all the required information regarding where to put new data.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.m_path
member.summary: Represents the current output path for new data. This path will be incremented during IncrementBranchIndices()

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.m_index
member.summary: Represents the current index in the current path where new data will be stored.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.Grafted
member.summary: If the current path has already been grafted, Grafted[i] will be True. If a path has been grafted, the path field of this instance will be incomplete.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.Index
member.summary: Gets or sets the item index component of the PathIndex.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.Path
member.summary: Gets the current path component of this PathIndex.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.Collides(Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.GH_Path)
member.summary: Test a path for potential collision.
member.returns: True if the path collides.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.Collision
member.summary: Gets or sets the collision path.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PathIndex.CollisionOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the collision offset.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_target
member.summary: Represents the data targets (paths and indices) of the current operation.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_allLists
member.summary: True if all input parameters have list access.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_list
member.summary: Current lists. Tree parameters do not have meaningful lists.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_listLength
member.summary: Length of each current List. If the branch is null, the length is set to 0.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_itemIndex
member.summary: Item indices for the current iteration. List and Tree parameters do not have meaningful indices.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_listIndex
member.summary: Branch indices for the current iteration. Tree parameters do not have meaningful indices.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.Input(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the input parameter at the specified index.
member.param: Index of input parameter. Must be valid

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.Output(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a pointer to the output parameter at the specified index.
member.param: Index of output parameter. Must be valid

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.CastData``1(System.Object,``0@)
member.summary: Convert data from the unknown type to a target type. Conversion is optimized and will only duplicate data if the types are not the same.
member.param: Output, is expected to be null.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.UpdateOutputPath
member.summary: Compute the new output path plus index. If there are no input parameters, the path root is incremented. If there is only a single input param, that path is copied. If there are multiple connected input params, the most complex path is copied.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.m_principalIndex
member.summary: Master parameter cache, do not access this directly, call MasterParameter() instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.PrincipalParameter
member.summary: Attempts to find the most important input parameter that defines this operation.
member.returns: The index of the master parameter or -1 if no master parameter can be identified.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.MostComplexParameter
member.summary: Returns the index of the most complex parameter. This parameter is key when deciding on output paths for components.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementBranchIndices
member.summary: Call this function to increment the branch indices. At present all branch indices are incremented whenever possible. This amounts to "Longest List Matching" logic. This function also resets all item indices.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure. If none of the branch indices are incremented, you should stop iteration.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices
member.summary: Call this function to increment the item indices inside the branches. Incrementation will occur in accordance with the DataMatching property of the owner component.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure. If the indices cannot be incremented, you should increment the branches next.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_ShortestList
member.summary: Increments all item indices using ShortestList Matching algorithms. If all parameters have been successfully incremented, the result is True.
member.returns: True if all non-list parameters have been incremented successfully.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_LongestList
member.summary: Increments all item indices using LongestList Matching algorithms. If at least one parameter has been successfully incremented, the result is True.
member.returns: True if at least one non-list parameters has been incremented successfully.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_All(System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Attempts to increment all item indices. Indices are not incremented beyond the end of their list. And list parameters are not incremented at all.
member.param: The number of successfully incremented indices.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementItemIndices_CrossReference(System.Int32)
member.summary: Attempts to increment one item index.
member.param: This function is recursive. If you're calling it from elsewhere, then supply zero as the layer hint.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.UpdateListPointer(System.Int32)
member.summary: This will update the cached reference and length of branch at the given parameter index (layer). The m_branch_index(layer) value must be correct before calling this function.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.Iteration
member.summary: Gets the current iteration count. The first time the SolveInstance() function is called on a component during a solution the Iteration counter will be zero. It will be incremented by one for every subsequent call.
member.returns: An integer representing the iteration count.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.IncrementIteration
member.summary: Increment the iteration count by 1.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.DisableGapLogic
member.summary: Call this function if you want to disable the gap null logic for the current iteration. After you call this function, nulls will not be inserted into output parameters when the component fails to assign data itself.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Component.GH_StructureIterator.DisableGapLogic(System.Int32)

member.param: Index of parameter for which to disable gap logic.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase
member.summary: The Phase flags are used to track object states during solutions.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Blank
member.summary: There is no data available in this object. This object will be solved next time a solution begins.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Collecting
member.summary: This object is currently in the process of collecting data

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Collected
member.summary: This object has finished collecting all data and is ready for computation.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Computing
member.summary: This object is currently in the process of computing new data

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Computed
member.summary: This object has successfully completed data computation and it will be skipped in the next solution unless it expires in the meantime. This is the final step in a successful solution cycle.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_SolutionPhase.Failed
member.summary: This object has failed to successfully complete the data computation stage. A new attempt at solving it will be made when the next solution starts. This is the final step in an unsuccessful solution cycle.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel
member.summary: Indicates the severity of a runtime message.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Blank
member.summary: No warnings or errors were recorded during solver-time processes

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Remark
member.summary: One of more messages (but no warnings and no errors) were recorded during solver-time processes.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Warning
member.summary: One or more warnings (but no errors) were recorded during solver-time processes

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel.Error
member.summary: One or more errors (and possibly any number of warnings) were recorded during solver-time processes.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject
member.summary: Base interface for all objects on the canvas that participate in solutions

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.ClearData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object needs to clear all solution data. This usually amounts to wiping volatile caches and messages. This function will not affect any other objects, but it will set the Phase flag to Blank

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.CollectData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object is required to collect all data. Either from Persistent records, from source params or whatever. This step is only performed if the phase flag is Blank or Failed. Upon completion, the phase flag will be set to Collected

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.ComputeData
member.summary: This function is called whenever the object is required to generate new data. This step is only performed by some objects and only when the Phase flag is Collected. Upon completion, the Phase will be Computed. If this object throws exceptions, it is the responsibility of the caller to set the Phase flag to Failed.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.Phase
member.summary: Gets the solution phase in which this object is currently stuck.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_ActiveObject.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets the locked flag of this object. Locked objects are ignored during solutions.

member.summary: Test whether this object is compliant with a given Rhino version.
member.returns: True if this object is compliant with the given Rhino release.

member.summary: Gets whether or not this object is capable of emitting data.

member.summary: Basic implementation of IGH_ActiveObject interface. Derive from this class rather than implementing IGH_ActiveObject to make your life easier.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ActiveObject.ExpireSolution(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Informs the document that owns this object that the solution has expired. The current object will be set to BLANK as a result. This method is recursive, it will also expire any and all objects which depend on this object. If you want a less destructive expiration, consider using ClearData(). If this object is already Blank, you should consider not expiring it.
member.param: If True, the document will be instructed to solve the new state.

member.summary: This function is called whenever the solution for this object expires. Override this function if objects depend on you.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ActiveObject.AddRuntimeMessage(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_RuntimeMessageLevel,System.String)
member.summary: Add a new message to this object. Valid message type flags are Warning and Error. If the Message string is empty or zero-length no message is added.
member.param: Type of message. Only Warnings and Errors are recorded.

member.summary: Gets the list of cached runtime messages that were recorded during solver-time processes.
member.returns: A list of runtime message strings.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ActiveObject.RuntimeMessageLevel
member.summary:
Returns the worst case flag for the current object
If the object contains at least 1 error, the result is Error.
If the object contains at least 1 warning, the result is Warning.
If the object contains at least 1 message, the result is Remark.
If the object contains no errors, no warnings and no messages, the result is Blank.

member.returns: If the return code is GH_GraphDrawInstruction.skip, the container will not draw the default tags.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.IGH_Graph.Draw_PostRenderTags(System.Drawing.Graphics,Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_GraphContainer)
member.summary: Override this function if you want to draw something on top of the Domain tags. This function is called whether or not cnt.LockGrips is true
member.param: The container that owns this graph instance and is responsible for the drawing.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.CreateDerivedDuplicate
member.summary: Implement this function and return an instance of yourself with all specific values copied. All properties in the GH_AbstractGraph class are copied by the GH_AbstractGraph.
member.remarks: If you don't want to use the base class copy-logic. Override Duplicate() instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.PrepareForUse
member.summary: This function is called when the graph is about to be used for the first time, maybe more often. You're supposed to reset all defaults. By default, this function calls ClearGrips(), CreateGrips() and UpdateEquation()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.EmitProxyObject
member.summary: Override this function if you want to be able to edit the graph through a PropertyGrid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.ValueAt(System.Double)
member.summary: This function supplies evaluation logic for the unit domains
member.param: parameter in unit domain to evaluate

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.IntersectionEvaluate(Rhino.Geometry.Curve,System.Double)
member.summary: Evaluates a curve by intersecting it with a vertical line at t
member.param: Curve to evaluate. Curve physical domain has to be between 0.0 and 1.0.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.UpdateEquation
member.summary: This function is usually called after a grip change. This is where you re-evaluate your equation constants based on grip locations.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.Grips
member.summary: Gets the grip collection, you'd be wise not to modify the collection. If you want to add or remove grips, use the AddGrip() and ClearGrips() methods instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.CreateGrips
member.summary: Override this function if your Graph supports grip controls

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_AbstractGraph.Internal_GripChanged(Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_GraphGrip,System.Boolean)
member.summary: By default, the grip is clamped to the unit domain and UpdateEquation is called. If you want to alter this behaviour, override this function.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.Kernel.Graphs.GH_GraphContainer.GraphChanged
member.summary: This event is raised whenever the underlying graph changes.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser
member.summary: Provides a run-time evaluator for Grasshopper expressions.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.ClearVariables
member.summary: Destroy the variable cache.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.ClearSymbols
member.summary: Destroy the Symbols cache.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.IsValidVariableName(System.String)
member.summary: Tests whether a string is a valid variable name for expressions. Valid names must contain at least one character, must start with an alphabetic character, and only contain alphanumeric chars and underscores.
member.returns: True if the name is valid (might still conflict with a function name though), false if not.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.CacheSymbols(System.String)
member.summary: Create a Symbols array from the expression. Use this method if you intend to evaluate the same expression multiple times. At this point, the expression has to be in correct syntax format. Use the GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteAll() method to make sure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.CachedSymbols
member.summary: Retrieve a copy of the Queue of cached symbols. You can use the cached symbols as an uber-optimization to speed up successive calls to Evaluate() with an identical expression string

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluate the expression currently loaded in the Symbols cache using the currently loaded variables.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.Evaluate(System.Collections.Generic.Queue{Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ParserSymbol})
member.summary: Evaluate the expression queue without overriding any local caches. You can obtain an expression queue by calling CachedSymbols()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.Evaluate(System.String)
member.summary: Store a new expression in the Symbols cache and evaluate it using the current variables

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionParser.BalancedCharTest(System.String,System.Char,System.Char,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Test a string for balanced open and close chars. You can use this function to see if brackets or parenthesis have been properly used.
member.param: Char that indicates an opening statement.
Char that indicates a closing statement.
The index at which the first error appears or -1 if no error was found.
member.returns: True if the chars are balanced, false if they are not.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteAll(System.String)
member.summary: Apply all syntax rulesets to the expression.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteForGraphicInterface(System.String)
member.summary: Rewrite the expression so that tags are replaced by the complex characters that make up the esoteric operators, functions and constants. The expression should become more readable

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteForGraphicInterface(Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_CodeString)
member.summary: Rewrite the expression so that tags are replaced by the complex characters that make up the esoteric operators, functions and constants. The expression should become more readable for humans.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteForEvaluator(System.String)
member.summary: Rewrite the expression so that all temporary keywords and symbols are replaced by evaluator-specific chars. The expression will become less readable, do not let the user see the result of this function. You need to rewrite the expression with this function if you intend to feed it into the Evaluator.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_ExpressionSyntaxWriter.RewriteForEvaluator(Grasshopper.Kernel.Expressions.GH_CodeString)
member.summary: Rewrite the expression so that all temporary keywords and symbols are replaced by evaluator-specific chars. The expression will become less readable, do not let the user see the result of this function. You need to rewrite the expression with this function if you intend to feed it into the Evaluator.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ParseExpression(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Attempts to parse an expression.
member.param: If True, and the result of the expression is a String, the result is parsed again until the result is no longer a String or until the expression fails.
member.returns: The result of the (recursive) expression.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.BackSolveExpression(System.String,System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Try and backsolve an expression
member.param: Value for variable that closest approximates the target value.
Value of expression for the best approximation.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure..

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.PureDateTicks
member.summary: Represents the total number of ticks past midnight that (by Grasshopper convention) identifies a pure date.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.PureTimeTicks
member.summary: Represents the total number of ticks past a whole second that (by Grasshopper convention) identifies a pure time.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.IsPureDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Tests whether a DateTime instance represents a pure date (i.e. that the time portion is undefined). Pure dates are a Grasshopper convention, basically a pure date is 1 tick past midnight.
member.returns: True if the date is considered pure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.IsPureTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Tests whether a DateTime instance represents a pure time (i.e. that the date portion is undefined). Pure times are a Grasshopper convention, basically a pure time is 2 ticks past any second.
member.returns: True if the time is considered undefined.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.GetTimeKind(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the kind of time implied by a System.DateTime value.
member.returns: GH_TimeKind.PureTime, GH_TimeKind.PureDate or GH_TimeKind.DateAndTime.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.GetTimeKind(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the kind of time implied by two System.DateTime values.
member.returns: GH_TimeKind.PureTime, GH_TimeKind.PureDate or GH_TimeKind.DateAndTime if both kinds are the same. GH_TimeKind.DateAndTime is one is a pure date and the other a DateAndTime value. GH_TimeKind.Mixed is one is a pure time and the other one is not.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.CreatePureDate(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert a datetime structure into a pure date, i.e. remove the time portion. As per convention, this leaves 1 tick into the day in question intact.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.CreatePureTime(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Convert a datetime structure into a pure time, i.e. remove the date portion. As per convention, this means setting the year, month and day to 1.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.CreatePureTime(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a pure time instance. If the total number of hours, minutes and seconds exceeds a full year then it is not possible to create a pure time and the largest possible pure time will be returned instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.CombineDateAndTime(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Combine a pure date and a pure time.
member.param: Must be a pure date instance.
Must be a pute time instance.
member.returns: A combined date and time.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.StringToDate(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Convert a string representing a date into an actual date. If a pure date is possible it will be returned. If the input is a pure time this method will fail, you need to use StringToTime instead.
member.param: If the string could be parsed, the pure date will be returned here.
member.returns: True if string was successfully parsed, false if not.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ParseGrasshopperDateConstants(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Tests to see if a string represents one of the constants.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ParseGrasshopperDateFormat(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Parses a string that adheres to the Grasshopper datetime formatting logic. {dddd, dd MMMM yyyy (HH:mm:ss)}

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ParseFlexibleDateFormat(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Parses a string that adheres to the Grasshopper datetime formatting logic. {dddd, dd MMMM yyyy (HH:mm:ss)}

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ParseDotNETDateFormat(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Parses a string that adheres to standard DotNET formatting rules. Parsing is attempted in current culture and En-US.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.ExtractDateStrings(System.String)
member.summary: Attempt to extract important parts of a Date/Time formatted string.
member.returns: An array of strings containing relevant parts of the text.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.TryParseDate(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Try and parse a string that contains only day, month and potentially year segments.
member.param: On auccess, date will be returned here.
member.returns: True if date could be parsed, false if not.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Convert.StringToTime(System.String,System.DateTime@)
member.summary: Convert a string representing a time into an pure time. Allowed separators of hour, minute and second portions are colons, semi-colons, points and commas. Grasshopper itself uses colons when formatting times. A PM or AM symbol is allowed provided it does not border on any alphabetical characters. A time can be prefixed by a "X day[s] + " string which defines the total number of 24-hour periods to include.
member.param: If the string could be parsed, the pure time will be returned here.
member.returns: True if string was successfully parsed, false if not.

member.summary: Empty constructor

member.summary: Create a new user object from an existing *.ghuser file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the file path this User Object is loaded from or saved to.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Guid of this User Object. The Guid is created anew during construction and is not stored in the User Object File. You should never have to set this field.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ComponentID of the IGH_DocumentObject that functions as the base class for this User Object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the serialized data. This data is used to deserialize a new instance of the base class.

member.summary: Gets or sets the icon associated with this User Object. If the icon hasn't been overridden, then a Default icon is returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Exposure of this User Object.

member.param: If true, a unique file path is assigned.

member.summary: Destroy all data except the file path and the ID.

member.param: Index of the output parameter at which to store the data.
Data to store. Data will be converted if necessary, but it will not be duplicated automatically.

members.member:
Retrieve an entire list of data from an input parameter during GH_Component.SolveInstance().
Type of the data to retrieve. If the data type does not match the parameter type, a conversion will be attempted. Name of input parameter from which to retrieve data. The data list will be appended to the supplied List. List must not be a null reference. True on success, false on failure.\ Parameter access by index is faster, consider using the other overload if possible.

The data tree target. The current value will be overwritten, you should probably pass in a null.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.
member.remarks: Parameter access by index is faster, consider using the other overload if possible.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_TypeLib
member.summary: Utility module that caches a number of oft-used types and type-ids for quick access. Do not change any of the values in this module or you'll wreck casting and conversion logic.

member.summary: Raises the SolutionExpired event on the toplevel object. You probably want to call ExpireSolution() instead of this method directly.
member.param: If True, the solution will be immediately recalculated.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DocumentObject.ExpireSolution(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call this function whenever you do something which expires the current solution. This will make sure all caches are erased, all downstream objects are expired and that the event is raised. The default implementation merely places a call to OnSolutionExpired(), override this function in derived classes to make sure you clear local data caches and expire downstream objects.
member.param: If True, the solution will be recomputed straight away.

If true, then a GotFocus event will lock the other menu items.
member.returns: The appended text box item.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the object. This field typically remains fixed during the lifetime of an object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the nickname of the object. This field can be changed by the user.

member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the object. This field typically remains fixed during the lifetime of an object.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.InstanceDescription
member.summary: Gets a description of the current state of the object. This field is usually the same as the Description() field, but it might be variable when overridden.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the Category in which this object belongs. If HasCategory() returns false, this field has no meaning.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.SubCategory
member.summary: Gets or sets the SubCategory in which this object belongs. If HasSubCategory() returns false, this field has no meaning.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.Keywords
member.summary: Gets a list of additional keywords that describe the object. Typically this list is empty but you can override this property to aid in object searches.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.HasCategory
member.summary: Gets whether or not the Category field has been set.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_InstanceDescription.HasSubCategory
member.summary: Gets whether or not the SubCategory field has been set.

member.summary: Generate a new random instance GUID

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.Write(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IWriter)
member.summary: Default serialization. Only stores Name, NickName, Description and InstanceGuid fields. If you want to store additional fields use WriteFull() instead.
member.returns: Always True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.Read(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IReader)
member.summary: Default deserialization. Only retrieves Name, NickName, Description and InstanceGuid fields. If you want to retrieve additional fields use ReadFull() instead. However, ReadFull() will only work if the archive was written using WriteFull().
member.returns: Always True.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.WriteFull(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IWriter)
member.summary: GH_InstanceDescription does not by default serialize all fields. Use this function to write all fields to the archive. This method is compatible with the default Write()/Read() operations.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_InstanceDescription.ReadFull(GH_IO.Serialization.GH_IReader)
member.summary: GH_InstanceDescription does not by default serialize all fields. Use this function to read all fields from the archive. This method is compatible with the default Write()/Read() operations.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes
member.summary: Base interface for all Attributes. Attributes are the visual portion of GH_DocumentObjects. They handle display, mouse events, layout, context menus etc. etc. You should consider inheriting from GH_Attributes or some other abstract class instead of implementing this interface from scratch.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.Pivot
member.summary: Gets the pivot for these attributes. The pivot controls the general placement of the attributes. If you want to move the attributes, change the pivot location.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.Bounds
member.summary: Gets the rectangle that contains the active content of the attributes. Typically the Contents determine the active area for menus, tooltips etc. Attributes are not supposed to draw objects beyond the Bounds.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.AllowMessageBalloon
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether these attributes allow warning and error boxes to be drawn on top of them.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.HasInputGrip
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not these attributes have an input grip.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.HasOutputGrip
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not these attributes have an output grip.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.InputGrip
member.summary: Gets the input grip location for these attributes. If HasInputGrip equals False, this point is meaningless.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.OutputGrip
member.summary: Gets the output grip location for these attributes. If HasOutputGrip equals False, this point is meaningless.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.IsPickRegion(System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Determines whether a point is within the pickable region for this object. By default, any point inside the Bounds is treated as pickable.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.IsPickRegion(System.Drawing.RectangleF,Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_PickBox)
member.summary: Determines whether a rectangle is a valid pick region for this object. By default, the picking rectangle is intersected with the Bounds rectangle.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.IsMenuRegion(System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Determines whether a point is available for context menu popups. By default, IsMenuRegion calls IsPickRegion(PointF).

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.ExpireLayout
member.summary: Expires the entire layout of the attributes. When overridden, implementer must place a call to the base class ExpireLayout().

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Attributes.PerformLayout
member.summary: Recompute the layout for these attributes. This function is automatically called during Drawing operations, so you typically don't have to.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DataComparison
member.summary: Enumerates all possible Data Matching algorithms for Components.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DataComparison.ShortestList
member.summary: Matches data in all lists until the shortest list runs dry. This flag will omit data entries if lists have a different length

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DataComparison.LongestList
member.summary: Matches data in all lists until the longest list runs dry. This is the default behaviour

member.name: F:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_DataComparison.CrossReference
member.summary: Matches data in all lists in all possible combinations. Careful, since this might results in stupendous amounts of data

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.Sources
member.summary: Gets a list of source parameters. Do not modify this list, if you wish to add or remove sources, use dedicated functions like AddSource() and RemoveSource instead.
member.returns: The sources for this parameter.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.SourceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of sources for this parameter.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.HasProxySources
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not this parameter maintains proxy sources. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.returns: True if the parameter has at least one proxy source, false if not.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.ProxySourceCount
member.summary: Gets the number of proxy sources for this parameter. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.returns: The number of proxy sources associated with this parameter.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.RelinkProxySources(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Document)
member.summary: Attempt to replace all proxy sources with real sources. Proxy sources are used during file IO, when actual sources might not be available yet. Once an IO operation has been completed there should be no more proxy sources.
member.param: The document from which to harvest the real source parameters.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.ClearProxySources
member.summary: Remove all proxy sources without attempting to relink them.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param.CreateProxySources

member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.InstantiateT
member.summary: Attempts to instantiate a new instance of T.
member.returns: This function should return a newly constructed instance of T.
member.remarks: If T is an abstract class or if T has no default (empty) constructor, this function will ASSERT. In order to avoid a Try...Catch block performance impact, override this function and call the type constructor for T directly.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.PreferredCast(System.Object)
member.summary: Implement this function if you're certain that you'll be confronted with very common casts. For example, GH_Point has a preferred cast from Rhino.Geometry.Point3d and GH_Number has a preferred cast from System.Double.
member.param: Data to convert. Data is never null.
member.returns: An instance of T or null if you did not handle the cast.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Cast_Object(System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to convert the Object reference into an instance of T. This method will perform a direct cast if possible or it will call Casting functions on T or Data if they exist. Data will not be duplicated unless a type conversion is required.
member.returns: The cast value or Nothing on failure.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_ComputeClippingBox

This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.
member.returns: The clipping box for all valid items.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_DrawWires(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_PreviewArgs)

This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_Param`1.Preview_DrawMeshes(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_PreviewArgs)
member.summary: This function can be used to iterate over all items in the Volatile data tree and call DrawViewportWires on each item that implements Preview.IGH_PreviewData. This function requires a lot of TypeOf and DirectCasting, so if you're worried about performance you should consider doing this yourself.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent
member.summary: Implement this interface in your component if you want to enable variable parameter UI.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CanInsertParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will get called before an attempt is made to insert a parameter. Since this method is potentially called on Canvas redraws, it must be fast.
member.param: Insertion index of parameter. Index=0 means the parameter will be in the topmost spot.
member.returns: Return True if your component supports a variable parameter at the given location.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CanRemoveParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will get called before an attempt is made to remove a parameter. Since this method is potentially called on Canvas redraws, it must be fast.
member.returns: Return True if your component supports removing a parameter at the given location.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.CreateParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will be called when a new parameter is about to be inserted. You must provide a valid parameter or insertion will be skipped. You do not, repeat not, need to insert the parameter yourself.
member.param: Insertion index of parameter. Index=0 means the parameter will be in the topmost spot.
member.returns: A valid IGH_Param instance to be inserted.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.DestroyParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.GH_ParameterSide,System.Int32)
member.summary: This function will be called when a parameter is about to be removed. You do not need to do anything, but this would be a good time to remove any event handlers that might be attached to the parameter in question.
member.returns: Return True if the parameter in question can indeed be removed. Note, this is only in emergencies, typically the CanRemoveParameter function should return false if the parameter in question is not removable.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_VariableParameterComponent.VariableParameterMaintenance
member.summary: This method will be called when a closely related set of variable parameter operations completes. This would be a good time to ensure all Nicknames and parameter properties are correct. This method will also be called upon IO operations such as Open, Paste, Undo and Redo.

member.summary: Create a new blank capsule with default radius and highlight dimensions.
member.param: Box for capsule dimensions. The box will be grown until it is at least 3 pixels wide and high.
member.returns: A new instance of GH_Capsule. Caller is responsible for disposing of the object.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.CreateCapsule(System.Drawing.Rectangle,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Palette,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new blank capsule.
member.param: Box for capsule dimensions. The box will be grown until it is at least 3 pixels wide and high.
Radius of rounded corners. A radius of zero or lower disables corner fillets.
Height of the highlight bar. A value of zero or lower disables the highlight.
member.returns: A new instance of GH_Capsule. Caller is responsible for disposing of the object.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.CreateCapsule(System.Drawing.Rectangle,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Palette,System.Int32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a new blank capsule.
member.param: Box for capsule dimensions. The box will be grown until it is at least 3 pixels wide and high.
Radii of rounded corners. This array must contain at least 4 integers. Radii are defined clockwise, starting at the upper left corner.
Height of the highlight bar. A value of zero or lower disables the highlight.
member.returns: A new instance of GH_Capsule. Caller is responsible for disposing of the object.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.RenderEngine
member.summary: Gets the RenderEngine associated with this capsule. You typically don't need to go this far, just use one of the Render() overloads on GH_Capsule directly.
member.remarks: Do not store pointers to the RenderEngine, always call this property anew.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the capsule onto a graphics context.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
If true, the capsule will be drawn with selected colours.
If True, the capcule will be drawn in Locked style.
If True, the capsule will be drawn in Hidden style.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom colour override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.

Base colour for the capsule. Other colours will be derived from the base colour. If you want full control over every colour involved, then use the overload that allows you to supply a custom Style instead.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom Style override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render the capsule onto a graphics context.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
Icon to render in center of content/bounding box.
If true, the capsule will be drawn with selected colours.
If True, the capcule will be drawn in Locked style.
If True, the capsule will be drawn in Hidden style.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Capsule.Render(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Have this capsule draw itself onto a Graphics surface with a custom colour override.
member.param: Graphics object to draw with. Zoom factor is implied by the G.Transform property.
Icon to render in center of content/bounding box.

Base colour for the capsule. Other colours will be derived from the base colour. If you want full control over every colour involved, then use the overload that allows you to supply a custom Style instead.
