Icon to render in center of content/bounding box.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine
member.summary: Provides basic Render methods for capsule display. You typically don't need this class, just use the Render() overloads on GH_Capsule directly.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.InnerContourPen(System.Single)
member.summary: Create a gradient from white to transparent white for the edge pen.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderGrips(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Render all the grips associates with the capsule. Grips are not drawn if the zoom level is less than 50%. This is usually the first stage in a Capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderGrips_Alternative(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Render all the grips associates with the capsule as semi-circles. This is needed if the capsule background is not fully opaque. Grips are not drawn if the zoom level is less than 50%. This is usually the first stage in a Capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderAlphaFill(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Render a standard transparancy background hatch. This is only needed when the capsule background colour is not fully opaque. This is usually the second stage in a capsule rendering, right after the Grips are drawn.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderBackground(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render a default capsule background fill. This is usually the third stage in a capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderBackground_Alternative(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Color,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Render a custom capsule background fill. This is usually the third stage in a capsule rendering.
member.param: If true, and the background colour is not opaque, an alpha grid will be drawn as well.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderHighlight(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Render a highlight bar. This is highly zoom-dependant. Highlight rendering is usually the fourth stage in a Capsule Rendering, after the background but prior to the edges.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderOutlines(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Single,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render default capsule outlines. If the zoom factor is less than 50% the inner outline is not drawn. This is usually the fifth stage in a Capsule rendering.
member.param: Palette style that defines edge properties.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderText(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Render the capsule text. This is usually the sixth and final stage in a capsule rendering.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderIcon(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render an image icon centered into the box. If the content box has been defined the icon will be centered there, otherwise the outline box will be used.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderIcon(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Render an image icon centered into the box. If the content box has been defined the icon will be centered there, otherwise the outline box will be used.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderBoundaryDots(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Int32,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render a collection of boundary dots along the top edge of the capsule.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_CapsuleRenderEngine.RenderMessage(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_PaletteStyle)
member.summary: Render a text message underneath the capsule.

members.member: Static (Shared in VB) method for creating rectangles with rounded corners. dd Rectangle to fillet. Rectangles smaller than 3 pixels wide/high will be grown. Radius of upper left corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of upper right corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of lower right corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. Radius of lower left corner. Zero or negative values omit fillets. If true, the left edge of the rectangle will be jagged and R0 and R3 will be ignored. If true, the right edge of the rectangle will be jagged and R1 and R2 will be ignored. Graphics path that describes the rounded rectangle.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Viewport.LimitUnit(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function for calculating pixel dimensions in a zoom-aware environment. The desired value is put through the zoom projection and if the resulting size (as displayed on the screen) exceeds the visual limits it is clipped. This function can be used for example to make sure that a certain penwidth never exceeds visual limits (i.e. it doesn't get too thin or too thick on the screen).
member.param: Minimum allowed visible size on screen.
Maximum allowed visible size on screen.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Viewport.SolveUnit(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Utility function for calculating graphics dimensions in a zoom-aware environment. This function can be used for example to compute the linewidth of a pen which always needs to appear as 3 pixels thick on the screen regardless of zoom values.
member.param: Minimum allowed size in graphics coordinates.
Maximum allowed size in graphics coordinates.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Valid Graphics flag. Even if the flag is set to true, though, the property may still return false if there is a problem with the internal graphics object.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.SetSmartTextRenderingHint
member.summary: When this method is called during a redraw, the TextRenderingHint of the associated graphics object will be set to either GH_CrispText or GH_SmoothText depending on zoom level.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.Painting
member.summary: Gets whether this canvas is currently busy painting itself.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.ZoomFadeLow
member.summary: Gets the ZUI fade alpha value for the low zoom level threshold. This static field gets set on every Canvas paint start. The low threshold is typically used for fading of icons and object names.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.ZoomFadeMedium
member.summary: Gets the ZUI fade alpha value for the medium zoom level threshold. This static field gets set on every Canvas paint start. The medium threshold is typically used for non-informative UI elements such as highlights.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.ZoomFadeHigh
member.summary: Gets the ZUI fade alpha value for the high zoom level threshold. This static field gets set on every Canvas paint start. The high threshold is typically used for ZUI elements that only appear when zoomed in.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPaintBegin
member.summary: Raised before a new paint operation starts. This event is always raised, even if the Canvas isn't visible.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPaintBackground
member.summary: Raised after the background has been drawn.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPrePaintGroups

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPostPaintObjects

member.summary: Raised before Widgets are drawn.

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPostPaintWidgets

member.name: E:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.CanvasPaintEnd

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.ScheduleInactive
member.summary: Defines the delay used to indicate the absence of a schedule.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas.ScheduleRegen(System.Int32)
member.summary: Schedule a regen to occur after the specified number of milliseconds have elapsed. If a Regen is called in this time frame, the schedule will be cleared. Only a single schedule can be active at any time, so any call to ScheduleRegen will clear existing schedules.
member.param: Number of milliseconds to wait until repainting the canvas. intervals equal to or less than zero will be ignored.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_ObjectResponse
member.summary: Lists the possible responses an object can give when confronted with a UI event.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_ObjectResponse.Ignore
member.summary: Event was ignored.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_ObjectResponse.Capture
member.summary: Event caused the object to become active.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_ObjectResponse.Release
member.summary: Object was active, but event caused object to become inactive.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_ObjectResponse.Handled
member.summary: Something happened, but no capture is needed.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.IGH_ResponsiveObject
member.summary: If you wish to participate in Canvas UI events, you must implement this interface.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.IGH_ResponsiveObject.RespondToMouseMove(Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas,Grasshopper.GUI.GH_CanvasMouseEvent)
member.summary: This function will be called when the mouse moves across the canvas. If you are active, you will be the only object who gets called. If you are inactive, you might get called if nobody on top of you decides to become active.
member.returns: All Response flags are valid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.IGH_ResponsiveObject.RespondToMouseDown(Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas,Grasshopper.GUI.GH_CanvasMouseEvent)
member.summary: This function will be called whenever a mouse button is pressed over the canvas. If you are active, you will be the only object who gets called. If you are inactive, you might get called if nobody on top of you decides to become active.
member.returns: All Response flags are valid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.IGH_ResponsiveObject.RespondToMouseUp(Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas,Grasshopper.GUI.GH_CanvasMouseEvent)
member.summary: This function will be called whenever a mouse button is released over the canvas. If you are active, you will be the only object who gets called. If you are inactive, you will not be called at all for MouseUp events.
member.returns: All Response flags are valid.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.IGH_ResponsiveObject.RespondToMouseDoubleClick(Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas,Grasshopper.GUI.GH_CanvasMouseEvent)
member.summary: This function will be called whenever the left button is double-clicked over the canvas. If you are active, you will be the only object who gets called.
member.returns: All Response flags are valid.

member.summary: Everything but the most egregious sexual innuendo is allowed.

member.summary: Unsubtle sexual/cultural/political content should not appear in this mode.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_PruderyFilter.High
member.summary: Vaguely suggestive cultural/political content is filtered. No sexual references whatsoever.

member.name: F:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_PruderyFilter.Total
member.summary: Anything that could even remotely cause offense should not appear.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_FadeAnimation.Evaluate(Grasshopper.GUI.Canvas.GH_Canvas)
member.summary: Reevaluate the fade animation parameters. You should call this method from within the Render method of your attributes. If an animation is currently in progress a redraw of the canvas will be scheduled, whether or not the attributes are actually visible on the canvas. You should therefore only call this method if your attributes are already drawing themselves.

member.summary: Create a new mouse tracker.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.FrameCount
member.summary: Gets the number of recorded frames.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Frame(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the position (in control coordinates) of the frame at the given index.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.OldestFrame
member.summary: Gets the oldest frame in recorded history.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.NewestFrame
member.summary: Gets the most recent frame in recorded history.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Duration
member.summary: Gets the timespan that has passed between the oldest and youngest recorded frames. This is not the same as the time that has passed since recording began.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.MaximumDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum allowed duration of the entire record. When new frames are recorded, old frames that are more distant than MaximumDuration will be dropped. The default duration is 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.MaximumFrameCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of frames to keep in history. If more frames are added, the oldest ones will be dropped. The default is 16,384 frames.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.TemporalAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum temporal accuracy. Frames that are closer together than the accuracy will not be recorded. The default accuracy equals 5ms.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Record(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Record a new mouse event frame. If this frame is closer than [Accuracy]ms to the previously recorded frame, it is not included.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Record(System.Drawing.Point,System.Object)
member.summary: Record a new mouse event frame. If this frame is closer than [Accuracy]ms to the previously recorded frame, it is not included.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.DropFrames(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Drop all frames older than a given limit.
member.param: All frames older than the limit will be dropped.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.DropFrames(System.Double)
member.summary: Find the youngest frame that deviates too much from the current locus and drop it and everything preceding it.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.DropFrames(System.Double,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Find the youngest frame that deviates too much from the given locus and drop it and everything preceding it.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Deviation
member.summary: Gets the maximum deviation of the recorded mouse path. The maximum deviation is the furthest distance the mouse has been from the first point in the history record.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.Deviation(System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets the maximum deviation of the recorded mouse path. The maximum deviation is the furthest distance the mouse has been from the first point in the history span. It does not measure the largest deviation between any two points in the time span, only the first and any subsequent point.
member.param: Represents the earliest time to include.
Represents the latest time to include.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_MouseTracker.LastFrameWithinDeviation(System.Double)
member.summary: Starting from the youngest frame, finds the oldest frame that is still within a maximum deviation of the youngest frame.
member.returns: The index of the oldest frame with a distance less than the deviation from the youngest frame, or -1 if no such frame could be found.

member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation mode for stack animations. Cubic results in a more natural motion. Although you can change the interpolation during animation, it might result in a discontinuous motion. You should set the desired interpolation algorithm during or directly after construction of this stack.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Vertical_ByIndex(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform top-to-bottom layout on a list of rectangles starting at the upper edge of the layout area. Rectangles are ordered by index. The height of the rectangles is guaranteed to remain the same.

member.param: Layout area. The right edge is ignored.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire height of the layout area.

member.summary: Perform top-to-bottom layout on a list of rectangles at the upper edge of the layout area.
member.param: Layout area. The bottom edge is ignored.
Radical index. The radical represents the special rectangle which takes positioning preference. For example, during Drag operations, the rectangle being dragged is the radical.
If True, the rectangles will be expanded to fill the entire width of the layout area.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.Layout.GH_GenericLayout.Horizontal_ByPosition(System.Drawing.Rectangle,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Drawing.Rectangle},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Perform left-to-right layout on a list of rectangles at the left edge of the layout area.

member.summary: Gets or sets the active region (in control coordinates) for this tooltip. Once a tooltip is shown inside the region, the tooltip will 'stick' to the mouse for as long as the mouse remains within this region. By default the region is set to Rectangle.Empty, which indicates that region tracking is not used for this tooltip.

How to use the Variables property when making a new GH_ExpressionEditor:
Dim editor As New GH_ExpressionEditor() editor.Expression = "Sin(p) + Cos(p*0.95) + A.z" editor.Variables.Add("p", New Expressions.VAR_Double(0.0)) editor.Variables.Add("A", New Expressions.VAR_Point(0.0, 0.0, 0.0)) editor.ShowDialog()

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendInteger(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a linear blend between two extremes. Although the inputs are unlimited integers, the output is an integer in the byte range (0-255).
member.returns: Interpolated value.
member.example:
This function is useful when you need to link colour alpha amounts to zoom levels:
Sub DrawZoomAwareCircle(ByVal G As Graphics, _ ByVal center As PointF, _ ByVal radius As Single, _ ByVal fill As Color) 'Find the zoom level of the Graphics transform. Dim zoom As Single = G.Transform.Elements(0)
'Abort if zoom less than 25% If (zoom < 0.25f) Then Return
'Blend the alpha channel byte between 25% and 95% zoom. Dim alpha As Int32 = GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendByte(0.25, 0.95, 0, 255, zoom) G.FillEllipse(center.X - radius, center.Y - radius, _ 2.0f * radius, 2.0f * radius, _ New SolidBrush(Color.FromARGB(alpha, fill))) End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.FadeColour(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Fade a colour to transparency by linearly blending a parameter between extremes.
member.param: Blending factor between t0 and t1.
member.returns: The colour adjusted for blending.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.BlendColour(System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Overlays two colours. The Alpha component of the top colour controls the blend.
member.returns: The blended colour. Alpha channels are added together.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.GUI.GH_GraphicsUtil.RenderTag(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.String,System.Drawing.Font,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.StringAlignment,System.Drawing.StringAlignment)
member.summary: Render a text tag into a Graphics surface.
member.param: The frame into which the tags should be aligned.
member.example:
This example shows how to render the 8 corner and edge tags into a rectangle:
Function RenderCornerAndEdgeTags(ByVal G As Graphics, ByVal frame As RectangleF) Dim font As New Font("Courier New", 8) Dim bg As Color = Color.White Dim fg As Color = Color.Black
'Render the 4 corner tags RenderTag(G, "UL", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "UR", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "LR", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Far) RenderTag(G, "LL", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Far)
'Render the 4 edge tags RenderTag(G, "T", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Center, StringAlignment.Near) RenderTag(G, "R", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Far, StringAlignment.Center) RenderTag(G, "B", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Center, StringAlignment.Far) RenderTag(G, "L", font, bg, fg, frame, StringAlignment.Near, StringAlignment.Center) End Function

member.example:
This example shows how to use this function to modify all the controls on a windows Form.
Dim frm As New MyVerySpecialForm() Grasshopper.GUI.GH_WindowsControlUtil.FixTextRenderingDefault(frm.Controls)
frm.Show()

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser
member.summary: Provides parsing methods for the Grasshopper Markdown flavour.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.#ctor
member.summary: This class provides only static (Shared in VB) methods and cannot be constructed.

member.name: P:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.Whitespace
member.summary: Gets an array of characters that are considered to be whitespace. At the moment, this array contains the space char and the tab char, it does not contain feeds or breaks.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.StringToFragment(System.String)
member.summary: Parse a block of text and return it as an interpreted IGH_Fragment.
member.returns: Fragment representing the text.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.RewriteHeaderTags(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Rewrite all paragraph and chapter header lines as #Title# blocks.
member.returns: Number of modifications made.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.RewriteLineEndings(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Fix whitespace at all line endings. Lines with two or more spaces will be limited to two spaces, lines with no or one space will be rewritten to contain a single space. Any tabs at the end of lines are ignored and removed.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.ExtractSharedLinks(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Find all shared link entries in a collection of textual lines and convert them to shared links. This method will remove all shared link lines from the input.
member.param: Text to parse, if shared links are found, they will be removed.
member.returns: A collection of shared links.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.CreateLogicalFragments(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Break a section of text into separate logical fragments. All text inside a single paragraph is considered a single logical fragment. Paragraphs are separated by one or more empty lines. Items in lists are also considered individual fragments.
member.returns: A collection of logical paragraphs.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsCommentLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line is a comment. Commented lines begin with double slashes (//) and are ignored during parsing.
member.param: Line to test. If you supply a multi-line string, death's too good for you.
member.returns: True if the line is a comment line.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsChapterHeaderLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line represents a chapter header underline. Chapter header underlines contain at least 4 consecutive equals symbols preceded or followed by any amount of white space.
member.returns: True if the line is considered to be a chapter header underline.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsParagraphHeaderLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line represents a paragraph header underline. Paragraph header underlines contain at least 4 consecutive dashes preceded or followed by any amount of white space.
member.returns: True if the line is considered to be a paragraph header underline.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsListLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line contains a list item.
member.returns: True if the line contains a list item.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsQuoteLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line is a block quote line. Block quotes start with a larger than symbol.
member.returns: True if the line is a block quote.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsLinkLine(System.String)
member.summary: Test whether a line represents a referenced link target. Note; this is a quick check. The link might still be invalid, use the IsLinkLine overload to include validity checks.
member.returns: True if the line is a referenced link.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Documentation.GH_Parser.IsLinkLine(System.String,System.String@,System.String@,System.String@)
member.summary: Test whether a line represents a referenced link target.
member.returns: True if the line is a referenced link.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Add (append) a data item to the last branch in the tree. If no branches exist yet, a new one will be created with [path = {0}]

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Insert(`0,Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.GH_Path,System.Int32)
member.summary: Insert a data item to the specified branch in the tree. If the branch doesn't exist yet, it will be created.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.AddRange(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0})
member.summary: Add (append) a list of data items to the last branch in the tree. If no branch exists yet, a new one will be created.

member.summary: Add (append) a list of data items to the specified branch in the tree. If the branch doesn't exist yet, it will be created.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.SimplifyPaths
member.summary: Simplify the branches in this tree by removing all identical path entries. The length of the shortest path will be indicative of the similarity search depth. If this tree only contains a single branch, the branch wil be simplified to its last index.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.RenumberPaths
member.summary: Renumber all paths in this data tree, using a single incrementing path index.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.RenumberPaths(System.String)
member.summary: Renumber all paths in this data tree, using a single incrementing path index.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Flatten(Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.GH_Path)
member.summary: Flattens the entire tree into a single path.
member.param: The path of the flattened data. If null, the path will be {0}

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Graft(Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.GH_Path,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Graft a single path in the tree. "Grafting" means appending a new branch for every item in an existing branch.
member.param: If true, null items in the grafted path will not be included in the new tree.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Graft(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Graft all paths in this tree. "Grafting" means appending a new branch for every item in an existing branch.
member.param: If true, null items in the grafted path will not be included in the new tree.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.MergeTree(Grasshopper.DataTree{`0})
member.summary: Merges two trees together. Data inside similar branches will be merged into single lists and unique paths will be appended. The other tree will not be altered, so beware that data is now shared among both trees.
member.exception: Thrown if other is a null reference.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.MergeStructure(Grasshopper.Kernel.Data.IGH_Structure,Grasshopper.Kernel.Parameters.IGH_TypeHint)
member.summary: Merge a Grasshopper parameter structure into this DataTree. Expert user function. If you don't know what a GH_Structure(Of T) is you don't have to worry about this method.
member.param: Type hint converter to use during merging.
member.remarks: Expert user function, don't go near GH_Structures if you're not intimately familiar with the Grasshopper SDK.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.Clear
member.summary: Clears the entire tree.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.ClearData
member.summary: Removes all data from all branches without affecting the tree topology.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.TrimExcess
member.summary: Trims the excess allocated memory in all branches

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.AllData
member.summary: Collects all data in the tree in a single list. Does not alter the topology of this tree.
member.returns: A linear list containing all data items in all branches.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.DataTree`1.MergeWithParameter(Grasshopper.Kernel.IGH_Param)
member.summary: Utility function for assigning Script Data Trees to output parameters. Expert user function, don't worry your pretty little head about this one.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

member.name: T:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface
member.summary: Plugin Interface object that is exposed via the RhinoScript layer.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsEditorLoaded
member.summary: Returns the loaded state of the Grasshopper Main window.
member.returns: True if the Main Grasshopper Window has been loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Editor Loaded: " & GH.IsEditorLoaded()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsEditorVisible
member.summary: Returns the visible state of the Grasshopper Main window.
member.returns: True if the Main Grasshopper Window has been loaded and is visible.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Editor Visible: " & GH.IsEditorVisible()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.LoadEditor
member.summary: Load the main Grasshopper Editor. If the editor has already been loaded nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.LoadEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.ShowEditor
member.summary: Show the main Grasshopper Editor. The editor will be loaded first if needed. If the Editor is already on screen, nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.HideEditor
member.summary: Hide the main Grasshopper Editor. If the editor hasn't been loaded or if the Editor is already hidden, nothing will happen.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.HideEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.EnableBanner
member.summary: Enables the display of the Grasshopper banner during Component loading. The banner is typically only shown once during a Grasshopper session, namely when the Editor is first loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.EnableBanner() Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.DisableBanner
member.summary: Disables the display of the Grasshopper banner during Component loading. The banner is typically only shown once during a Grasshopper session, namely when the Editor is first loaded.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.DisableBanner() Call GH.ShowEditor() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.IsSolverEnabled
member.summary: Returns the state of the Grasshopper Solver.
member.returns: True if the Grasshopper Solver is enabled.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call Rhino.Print("Grasshopper Solver Enabled: " & GH.IsSolverEnabled()) Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.EnableSolver
member.summary: Enables the Grasshopper Solver. If the Solver is enabled, expired components and parameter will be recomputed.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.EnableSolver() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.DisableSolver
member.summary: Disables the Grasshopper Solver. If the Solver is disabled, expired components and parameter will not be recomputed, though any existing solution will remain intact.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.DisableSolver() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.RunSolver(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the solver once, even if the global solver lock is on.
member.param: If true, will expire all objects in the current document.

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.OpenDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Open a Grasshopper document. The editor will be loaded if necessary, but it will not be automatically shown.
member.param: Path of file to open (must be a *.gh or *.ghx extension).
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.OpenDocument("C:\ExampleFile.ghx") Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.CloseDocument
member.summary: Close the currently active Grasshopper document. If there is not active document, nothing will happen.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.CloseDocument() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.CloseAllDocuments
member.summary: Close all Grasshopper documents.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.CloseAllDocuments() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.SaveDocument
member.summary: Save the currently active Grasshopper document. If the active document has never been saved, a Save... dialog will be shown. If there is no active document, nothing will happen.
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.SaveDocument() Set GH = Nothing End Sub

member.name: M:Grasshopper.Plugin.GH_RhinoScriptInterface.SaveDocumentAs(System.String)
member.summary: Save the currently active Grasshopper document in a specific location. If there is no active document, nothing will happen.
member.param: Path of file to save to (must be a *.gh or *ghx extension).
member.returns: True on success, false on failure.

example.code: Call GrasshopperExampleScript() Sub GrasshopperExampleScript() Dim GH Set GH = Rhino.GetPlugInObject("Grasshopper") Call GH.SaveDocumentAs("C:\GrasshopperBackup\[" & Hour(Now()) & "][" & Minute(Now()) & "][" & Second(Now()) & "].ghx") Set GH = Nothing End Sub
